answerText: Aral Sea[10] One reason that the Aral Sea has shrunk was the extensive cultivation of this crop on the rivers' plains in the Soviet Union. Uzbekistan is the world's fifth-leading producer of this commodity.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Bellevue + Michigan A + Georgia Tech | 10 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This lake is fed by Amu Darya and the Syr Darya. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Central Asian lake located in Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan which has shrunk by 75% of its original volume.
